title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Pink, orange and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite left on mount: brackets and "supposed to be 1/12"; in graphite across upper edge of mount: "warp" [upside down] and [arrow]; in graphite across lower edge of drawing [upside down] "repeat" and brackets; in graphite upper right corner: 10

Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 32; in graphite upper center: 3 3/8; in graphite at right: 3 3/8 - 4 in 13 1/2
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of small white circles with white centers, orange and pink quatrafoils and diamonds, interspersed among graphite triangles and diamonds executed in short parallel graphite strokes

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Pink, orange and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-450.
